query: I'm having a game night with friends and need some help with a few things. Could you simulate rolling 4 dice 5 times using the Regular dice rolls tool? I'd also like to try a custom 6-sided die 3 times. While we're waiting for everyone to arrive, I want to look up detailed information about the Pokémon 'Azumarill' from the Pokémon Unite database. My friend mentioned some Batman games I might enjoy - would you mind showing me up to 10 results that don't need to be exact matches? Also, a couple of us are thinking about trying Lost Ark, so I'd appreciate seeing a list of all available character classes and subclasses. Oh, and one last thing - can you search for information about an author named 'Travis North' using the OpenCritic API? He apparently writes great game reviews.

tool_list.tool name: Dice Roll Simulator: Regular dice rolls
tool_list.tool description: Rolls any number of regular dice any number of times, allowing you to specify both the quantity of dice and how many rolls to perform. This uses the ultimate dice rolling API to simulate virtual dice of any size, providing random number generation for gaming, statistical simulations, or decision making. The service handles all the randomization logic, delivering consistent and truly random results for tabletop gaming, role-playing games, or any scenario requiring fair dice outcomes.

tool_list.tool name: Dice Roll Simulator: Custom dice rolls
tool_list.tool description: Simulates rolls of custom dice with specified number of sides, allowing for specialized tabletop gaming scenarios that require non-standard dice configurations. This endpoint provides flexible random number generation for unique gaming systems, homebrew rules, or specialized probability simulations.

While you're at it, could you pull up the latest Rocket League news and blog posts? I've got a tabletop session tonight and need you to roll both a standard six-sided die and a special 20-sided die for me. I'm curious about which titles made OpenCritic's Hall of Fame for 2023. Oh, and can you show me the first page of Pokemon Unite characters, just limiting it to 20 per page? One last thing - I need to practice my chess skills, so could you retrieve that chess puzzle with ID 'HxxIU' for me?

tool_list.tool name: Epic Games Store - Free Games: Free Games
tool_list.tool description: Retrieves all currently available and upcoming free games from the Epic Games Store, including details about each title and its availability period. This endpoint leverages an unofficial API designed for scraping game offer data, utilizing web scraping techniques to extract real-time information from the Epic Games Store's frontend, providing developers and users with a convenient way to track free game promotions without direct access to Epic's official systems.

Sorts game giveaways by specified criteria such as date, value, or popularity. This functionality is part of the GamerPower.com API, which provides programmatic access to a database of free games, loot, and giveaways, enabling users to efficiently discover and track gaming deals based on their preferences.

Retrieves the latest news articles and updates about Rocket League from the dedicated endpoint. This service is part of a comprehensive Rocket League API that delivers fast, powerful access to game data including rankings, player statistics, and other essential information, allowing users to stay informed about game developments, updates, tournaments, and community events.

Retrieves blog posts and news content from the Rocket League API endpoint. This service is part of the fastest and most powerful Rocket League API, providing comprehensive coverage of the game including ranks, player statistics, news updates, and other essential information for Rocket League enthusiasts and developers.

Rolls one regular six-sided die, providing a single random number from 1 to 6. This uses the ultimate dice rolling API, which can handle dice of various sizes and quantities, allowing for everything from simple single-die rolls to complex combinations needed for tabletop gaming, probability demonstrations, or random number generation.

Retrieves the Hall of Fame list for a specific year. This endpoint is part of an API that provides access to video game and review data, leveraging its database of game listings and critical assessments to surface historically significant titles recognized in the Hall of Fame for targeted years.

tool_list.tool name: Pokemon Unite Pokemons: List all Pokemons
tool_list.tool description: Retrieves a comprehensive list of all Pokémon in Pokemon Unite. This leverages the game's internal database to provide accurate and up-to-date character information, enabling players to reference and strategize effectively during matches.

Rolls one die with any number of sides, allowing you to specify custom dice beyond the standard 6-sided variety. This endpoint is part of the ultimate dice rolling API that enables users to simulate various dice configurations for gaming, probability exercises, or random number generation needs. Whether you need a d4, d20, or even custom dice with hundreds of sides, this tool provides a simple way to get truly random rolls without the physical limitations of real dice.
Retrieves a single, specific chess puzzle using its unique ID. This tool queries a comprehensive database of over 2 million chess puzzles to fetch the details of the requested puzzle.

query: I've been diving into the gaming world lately across several platforms. Could you help me find some free-to-play PC games that have both MMORPG and fantasy elements? I'm also curious about how many players are currently active in different Rocket League playlists. For Lost Ark, I'd love to learn more detailed information about the character classes, available raids, engravings, and islands with their specific dropped items. While I'm looking for new games, could you check CheapShark for any Batman game deals, limiting the results to 20? On the tabletop side of things, I need a quick simulation of 5 rolls of a 6-sided die for a game I'm playing. I'm also following the competitive scene, so could you pull up the upcoming CSGO matches and tournaments, just showing the first 10 results? Lastly, I'd appreciate if you could retrieve the complete Pokédex listing specifically for the UK region.
